Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Parecoxib as an Analgesic Adjuvant in Brachial Plexus Nerve Block

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly allocated into three groups

Intervention.evidence: Group A (n=50) received ropivacaine 0.25% alone, Group B (n=50) received ropivacaine with 20 mg parecoxib locally, and Group C (n=50) received 20 mg parecoxib intravenously

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the analgesic efficacy of parecoxib

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the duration of sensory and motor blocks, assessed over a 24-hour postoperative period

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group assignments

Number_Randomised.evidence: 150 patients undergoing elective forearm surgery from January 2009 to November 2010

Number_Analysed.evidence: Participants were randomly allocated into three groups: Group A (n=50), Group B (n=50), and Group C (n=50)

Result_Outcome.evidence: Group B demonstrated significantly prolonged motor and sensory block times compared to Group A (mean difference = X hours, 95% CI Y to Z; p < 0.05)

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in any group
